summary: ShellToolCallParams now carries optional run_in_background and description fields so models can request background shells and attach user-friendly labels.
Shell handler detects run_in_background, delegates to BackgroundShellManager::start, and includes description in promotion results.
Tool registry exposes bash_output/kill_shell specs and registers BackgroundShellHandler; shell schema documents run_in_background usage.
MCP transport tests updated for new env_vars/cwd/http_headers fields to satisfy serde defaults.

Ctrl+Shift+B now opens the process manager overlay; the App handles every UnifiedExec AppEvent (refresh, windowed output, input, export, kill/remove) by calling CodexConversation APIs and updating the UI.
Helper methods fetch session snapshots/output, send stdin chunks, export logs, and automatically refresh the manager after lifecycle actions.
ChatWidget can now render ProcessManagerView and ProcessOutputView in the bottom pane, updating existing overlays instead of showing placeholders.
CustomPromptView inputs let users send background shell stdin or choose export destinations, and the footer advertises the new Ctrl+Shift+B shortcut.
Added a debug-only cfg_attr dead_code allowance so the release-only update banner logic stops tripping Clippy when running dev builds.
BottomPane::status_indicator_visible is now test-only and the unused show_custom_view helper was dropped, eliminating the need for crate-wide dead_code allowances.
Collapsed the nested MCP wizard template bootstrap if to appease clippy::collapsible_if without altering behavior.
Exec history now annotates each completed call with per-stream metrics (stdout/stderr line counts) so users can see whether failures emitted diagnostics without opening the process manager.
UpdateAvailableHistoryCell and its App usage are compiled only for release builds, preventing debug-only clippy dead_code warnings while keeping the banner behavior unchanged for shipped builds.
RtOptions dropped unused builder APIs—only the test-only break_words helper remains—so production builds no longer need #[allow(dead_code)] scaffolding for the wrapping utilities.
McpWizardDraft/McpServerSnapshot getters are now actively exercised (no dead_code allowances) since the wizard populates configs through those accessors during apply_template/summary flows.
Documented the full background-shell workflow: Ctrl+B promotion, Ctrl+R Live Exec overlay, Ctrl+Shift+B process manager with keymap, and the scoped log window controls (g/G, Alt+PgUp/PgDn, export).
Added API-facing notes for run_in_background, bash_output, and kill_shell so external agents can mirror the TUI behavior.
